messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:16): right let's see
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:18): XHTML2 only started in 2002?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:18): wow
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:18): lachy: you have a sentence that goes "However, ..., but ..." which is awkward
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:18): did it start earlier than that?  I think that was the first draft i found
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:19): yeah, I should fix that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:19): dunno, you have internal access now :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:21): "there are over 300 participants already" is ambiguous about which group you mean
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:21): i'd write "there are over 300 participants in the W3C group already"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:21): or some such
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:21): though if you say that you might want to also point out that there are over 700 in the whatwg :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:25): "These days, the W3C process is quite strict." the process is... doesn't mean much has changed though
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:26): other than that looks good
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:32): Fixed the participant issue and the "however/but" issue
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:33): should I change anything about the W3C process?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (05:35): your answers seemed generally good
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:36): the first public draft of XHTMl2 is 20020805, I'm trying to find anything in the member section that would indicate when they actually started
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:36): look in w3c-html-wg around that time maybe
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:41): that's where I'm looking
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:41): I found a few brief mentions of XHTML2 in a few threads, but nothing linking to an editors draft or anything
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:42): I might just say it began around 2001-2002
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:46): updates the whatwg.org front page
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:46): it's been dragged kicking and screaming into 2007
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:46): I changed it to "XHTML2 has been in <em>secret</em> development since around 2001‚Äì2002 and..."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:46): hah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:46): nice
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (05:49): the new layout doesn't look right in Safari 2.0.4
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:49): that's ironic, given that i used safari trunk to do it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:49): can't win, i guess :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:49): maybe you should add opt-in versioning in your browser, i hear that solves this kind of problem
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:50): fixes
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (05:51): we'll only render it right if you specifically request IE8 mode

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:53): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 - as far as the "They include representatives from 4 major browser vendors: Mozilla, Opera, Safari and IE" part, Nokia also makes a browser and is a member of the HTML WG.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:53): i wouldn't call nokia a "major browser vendor"
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (05:53): so does AOL, if you want to get technical
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:53): and the w3c...
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:54): they're the 4 that most people will care about.  There's no need to list every single particpant
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (05:54): I wonder if Nokia or Apple have shipped more browsers...
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (05:54): although, I could link to the participant list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:54): db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d: better question, which has had the most page views of public web content with their browsers?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (05:54): Nokia has probably shipped more total browser units, but likely fewer of browsers actually written by them rather than licensed
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (05:55): but all the browsers they shipped probably add up to less use share than Safari
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (05:55): if web stats can be at all trusted
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (05:55): gotta roll
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (05:55): later folks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:55): later
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (05:55): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, yeah, they're both probably important metrics
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:55): install base isn't a particularily interesting metric
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:55): by install base, lynx has huge numbers.
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (05:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, not that huge - but probably similar to Safari
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:56): every linux server out there has lynx on it
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (05:57): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, it's not installed by default on Debian & Ubuntu...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:57): is links?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:57): elinks?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:57): Emacs/W3?
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (05:57): not even w3m
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (05:57): not even wget
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:57): wow, how are you supposed to browse the web through a shell on those boxes? how retarded.
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (05:57): I'm not even sure about telnet
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (05:57): "apt-get install lynx"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:58): in any case
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:58): usage is what matters, not install base

db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (06:00): I think install base can be an interesting number. Perhaps Nokia would have interesting ideas about why people aren't using the browsers they're shipping. Certainly ui, network speed and cost are factors but perhaps there are issues at the protocol and formats level that affect it.
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (06:00): And that's only kind of a devil's advocate position

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (06:00): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, indeed.  If installed base mattered, then IE would have 100% of all Windows machines, but we know that there are many windows users that use other browsers

db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (06:01): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, but Nokia has customers who chose to buy a product with web browsing as a feature, but for some reason they're not using it.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (06:01): + a small percentage of Mac and Linux web that run IE through virtualisation or other means
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (06:01): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, those people are interesting
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:01): support for real Web applications is also what matters. Nokia's Webkit-based browser has CSS, Javascript/XHR support.
db7449d0d57e60791235054bcf9c7e5d (06:02): my mobile browser didn't do any of that stuff :(
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:02): and I'm not sure why it's important to make the distinction of "major" browser vendors
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:02): btw if anyone wants to twitter to the whatwg account for some reason (e.g. if you want to hack the blog so it twitters when there's a new post), let me know
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:03): i don't want to put the password out, since then we could lose control of the account if anyone wants to be nasty
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (06:03): we could set the blog up so that the excerpt gets twittered
